comment.body:
Interesting post.

I have a Huawei E5377 as my LTE modem, and am planning to migrate to Linux in a couple of months. Will that combination work?

> [satoxyn1](#comment_1_1LGApmQZPN49nawg4HQQgf8ToVUPxGe2Zq): E5377 is based on Balong V7R2, which is a bit problematic on Linux. Most probably, it won't be visible in NetworkManager as a network device and may require manual configuration using distributive's native network configuration means.

Thanks for the info. And sorry for the late reply, I never noticed your response in my feed.

@satoxyn1:
I'm confused: isn't WiFi the *only* way to use it? I mean, I connect my computer to the modem by WiFi in order to access the internet through the modem's cellular connection. Is there some other way to do it?

Also I don't think I can use a different modem: the data-only plan I have from my telco has restrictions. I only get unlimited data if I use the SIM in the device they provided, the E5377, and only at my home address. I tried putting the SIM in another device, a phone, and using it elsewhere, but the connection was soon throttled & capped.

Thanks for all your help.

Ah, finally found something in English [here](https://www.manualslib.com/manual/1132282/Huawei-E5377.html?page=5#manual). So I can access the internet through USB connection to the modem, and there's an optional accessory for ethernet.
